alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 10:22PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Niobrara, northeastern Albany, northern Platte and southeastern Converse Counties through 1115 PM MDT... At 1021 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 20 miles west of Bill to 8 miles south of Douglas to near Garrett. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Douglas, Wheatland, Glendo, Esterbrook, Lakeview North, Sibley Peak, Westview Circle, Friend Park Campground, Two Moon Campground, Laramie Peak, Esterbrook Campground, Keeline, Glendo Reservoir, Harris Park, Manning Ranch, Y-O Ranch, Lance Creek and Lost Springs. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 76 and 144. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Niobrara County; North Laramie Range
